title: State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, Lies - Collection27 (Russia5)
description:
State-Sponsored Terrorism, Crimes, and Lies - Collection 27 (Russia 5):

We have 35 titles here:

-  Amnesty Int. - One Year On; Violations of the Rights of Freedom of Expression, Assembly and Association in Crimea (2015)

-  Amnesty Int. - Russian Federation; New Laws Lead to Increased Repression of Fundamental Rights (2013)

-  Applebaum (Ed.) - Gulag Voices; an Anthology (2011)

-  Balmaceda - Energy Dependency, Politics and Corruption in the Former Soviet Union; Russia's Power, Oligarchs' Profits .. (2008)

-  Barenberg - Gulag Town, Company Town; Forced Labor and Its Legacy in Vorkuta (2014)

-  Barnes - Death and Redemption; The Gulag and the Shaping of Soviet Society (2011)

-  Bullough - Let Our Fame Be Great; Journeys Among the Defiant People of the Caucasus (2010)

-  Farah & Braun - Merchant of Death; Money, Guns, Planes and the Man Who Makes War Possible (2007)

-  Fortescue - Russia's Oil Barons and Metal Magnates; Oligarchs and the State in Transition (2006)

-  Frierson - Silence Was Salvation; Child Survivors of Stalin's Terror and World War II in the Soviet Union (2015)

-  Gammer - Muslim Resistance to the Tsar; Shamil and the Conquest of Chechnia and Daghestan (1994)

-  Gammer (Ed.) - Ethno-Nationalism, Islam and the State in the Caucasus; Post-Soviet Disorder (2008)

-  George - The Politics of Ethnic Separatism in Russia and Georgia (2009)

-  Gessen - The Man without a Face; the Unlikely Rise of Vladimir Putin (2012)

-  Ghaleb - Natural Gas as an Instrument of Russian State Power (2011)

-  Grant - Aggression Against Ukraine; Territory, Responsibility, and International Law (2015)

-  Harris (Ed.) - The Anatomy of Terror; Political Violence Under Stalin (2013)

-  Hoffman - The Oligarchs; Wealth and Power in the New Russia (2011)

-  HRW - Abandoned by the State; Violence, Neglect, and Isolation for Children with Disabilities in Russian Orphanages (2014)

-  HRW - Worse than War; Disappearances in Chechnya (2005)

-  Kalb - Imperial Gamble; Putin, Ukraine, and the New Cold Order (2015)

-  Malia - The Soviet Tragedy; a History of Socialism in Russia, 1917-1991 (1994)

-  Menon & Rumer - Conflict in Ukraine; the Unwinding of the Post-Cold War Order (2015)

-  Nygren - The Rebuilding of Greater Russia; Putin's Foreign Policy Towards the CIS Countries (2008)

-  Przeworski (Ed.) - Democracy in a Russian Mirror (2015)

-  Radchenko - Unwanted Visionaries; the Soviet Failure in Asia at the End of the Cold War (2014)

-  Rayfield - Stalin and His Hangmen; the Tyrant and Those Who Killed for Him (2005)

-  Sakwa - The Quality of Freedom; Khodorkovsky, Putin, and the Yukos Affair (2009)

-  Sixsmith - Putin's Oil; the Yukos Affair and the Struggle for Russia (2010)

-  Soldatov & Borogan - The Red Web; the Struggle between Russia's Digital Dictators and the New Online Revolutionaries (2015)

-  Stewart et al (Eds.) - Presidents, Oligarchs and Bureaucrats; Forms of Rule in the Post-Soviet Space (2012)

-  Tishkov - Chechnya; Life in a War-Torn Society (2004)

-  Vaknin - Russian Roulette, Russia's Economy in Putin's Era (2003)

-  Valikhanof & Michell - The Russians in Central Asia; Their Occupation of the Kirghiz Steppe and the Line of the Syr-Daria, .. (1865)

-  van Herpen - Putinism; the Slow Rise of a Radical Right Regime in Russia (2013)
